title: How to Make a Cream Filling for Chocolates

steps.title: Combine butter, powdered sugar and milk.
steps.content: Combine butter, powdered sugar and milk. Put the softened butter, powdered sugar and milk in a mixing bowl. Using an electric mixer or a wooden spoon, beat together until smooth and pliable.

steps.title: Beat in flavoring and/or coloring, if desired.
steps.content: Beat in flavoring and/or coloring, if desired. Add flavoring or coloring to the dough, beating in. These make the chocolates more interesting. Only use a small amount of either ingredient as it can make the dough too runny.

steps.title: Roll into balls.
steps.content: Roll into balls. Take tablespoonfuls of dough and, using your hands, roll them into balls, about the size of a grape.

steps.title: Place balls on greased baking sheet.
steps.content: Place balls on greased baking sheet. Grease a baking sheet with butter or cooking oil spray, then arrange the balls on a greased baking sheet.

steps.title: Freeze balls until firm.
steps.content: Freeze balls until firm. Put the sheet in a freezer and freeze for 15 minutes for the balls to firm up.

steps.title: Melt the chocolate.
steps.content: Melt the chocolate. Put the chocolate in a heatproof bowl and microwave in 30-second intervals, stirring between each interval, until melted.

steps.title: Dip the balls in the melted chocolate.
steps.content: Dip the balls in the melted chocolate. Use tongs or a fork to dip the balls, making sure the balls are submerged in melted chocolate. Place them in baking sheet.

steps.title: Leave to set.
steps.content: Leave to set. You can speed up the process by putting the chocolates in the fridge to cool and set, but only for a few minutes.

steps.title: Take a bite as a reward or to taste.
steps.content: Take a bite as a reward or to taste. This step is entirely optional.
